name: py-datalad-neuroimaging

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: DataLad extension package for neuro/medical imaging

dependencies.name: git-annex
dependencies.description:
git-annex allows managing files with git, without checking the file
contents into git. While that may seem paradoxical, it is useful when
dealing with files larger than git can currently easily handle, whether
due to limitations in memory, time, or disk space.

dependencies.name: py-datalad
dependencies.description:
data distribution geared toward scientific datasets. DataLad makes data
management and data distribution more accessible. To do that, it stands
on the shoulders of Git and Git-annex to deliver a decentralized system
for data exchange. This includes automated ingestion of data from online
portals and exposing it in readily usable form as Git(-annex)
repositories, so-called datasets. The actual data storage and permission
management, however, remains with the original data providers.

dependencies.name: py-datalad-deprecated
dependencies.description:
DataLad extension package for deprecated functionality that was phased
out in the core package.

dependencies.name: py-datalad-metalad
dependencies.description: DataLad extension for semantic metadata handling

dependencies.name: py-nibabel
dependencies.description: Access a multitude of neuroimaging data formats

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pybids
dependencies.description: bids: interface with datasets conforming to BIDS

dependencies.name: py-pydicom
dependencies.description:
Pure python package for DICOM medical file reading and writing pydicom
is a pure Python package for working with DICOM files. It lets you read,
modify and write DICOM data in an easy "pythonic" way.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-datalad-hirni
dependent_to.description: DataLad extension for raw data capturing and conversion workflows
